header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 19

central_thesis: The primary magical and philosophical thesis presented in this issue, particularly in Sinclair's article, is that 'dæmon lovers' (Incubus/Succubus) are not objective entities but subjective creations of the magician's will and imagination. True Setian advancement involves mastering one's will to manifest such phenomena, maintaining perspective, and moving beyond the novice's confusion of subjective and objective realities. The broader context of the Scroll reflects an ongoing development of Setian philosophy, community, and practical application, acknowledging internal evolution and external challenges.

structure_content.chapter_title: Things That Go Hump In The Night
structure_content.summary: This article analyzes the nature of Incubus and Succubus from a Setian perspective, reframing them as manifestations of the magician's will rather than external entities. It discusses the evolution of understanding from traditional occult views to the Setian mastery of subjective creation, emphasizing the importance of maintaining perspective and differentiating subjective experience from objective reality in magical practice.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Temple of Set and the I.R.S.
structure_content.summary: This section provides administrative guidance for Temple of Set members regarding tax deductions for contributions, uniforms, and expenses incurred while acting as official representatives. It highlights the Temple's status as a recognized religious institution and encourages members to exercise their legal rights concerning taxation.

This brief announcement details plans for a regional meeting of Setians in the southeastern United States. It solicits interest and suggestions for potential dates and locations, indicating an active and collaborative community within the Temple of Set.

A quiz designed to test members' knowledge of previously published material in 'The Scroll of Set.' It serves as a tool for reinforcing shared lore, philosophical concepts, and historical facts pertinent to the Temple of Set's curriculum and communal understanding.

This philosophical reflection discusses the deteriorating condition of the human race and the concept of 'Setamorphosis' as an impending transformation. It raises ethical questions for Setians regarding their role and responsibilities in a world perceived to be ruled by 'euphemisms and repression,' specifically on the dilemma of aiding others amidst societal turmoil.

key_concepts.definition: These entities are understood not as independent, objective beings, but as 'creations of his or her own mind, with no existence other than that which we choose to give them.' They are 'creatures of delight, to be summoned at will,' manifesting through the magician's 'imagination and desire' and ceasing to exist when no longer thought of.

The fundamental power of the Setian, developed through 'evolution of the will and clarity of perception,' enabling the magician to bring subjective entities and phenomena into being. Its mastery involves applying this will effectively to the universe and recognizing its effects, while understanding the internal locus of magical power.

A crucial skill for advanced Setians, involving the ability to differentiate between subjective magical creations (like Incubus/Succubus) and objective reality. Maintaining perspective ensures that intense and pleasurable magical experiences remain healthy and do not lead to confusion or 'running-in-circles' typical of novice magicians.

A core distinction in Setian magical development. Novices often confuse these, while advanced Setians master the understanding that many magical phenomena, particularly those involving entities like dæmon lovers, are subjective creations brought into being by the individual's 'own heightened powers' rather than existing independently.

A concept posited as an impending, profound transformation or crisis for the human race, suggesting a period of significant change and potential upheaval that Setians anticipate as a result of humanity's 'incompetence or destructiveness'.

practical_system.description: The practical system described emphasizes the cultivation and application of the individual's 'will' and 'clarity of perception' to manifest desired magical phenomena, specifically 'dæmon lovers' (Incubus/Succubus) as prime examples of subjective creations. It operates on the principle that these entities gain 'existence by the creative power of our own wills' and are not external, objective beings. The practice involves summoning these creations through focused imagination and desire, allowing for 'highly intense and quite pleasurable' physical sensations, while crucially maintaining 'perspective' to avoid confusing subjective experience with objective reality. This internal locus of power is a cornerstone, distinguishing it from systems relying on external invocation or conjuration of pre-existing entities. The goal is mastery over one's own consciousness and its ability to shape personal reality and experience.
rituals: Summoning of 'nameless and unspeakable playmates' (Incubus/Succubus) through focused imagination and desire to bring subjective entities into conscious, sensuous experience.

relevant_quotes.text: Incubus: A spirit or dæmon who has carnal relations with mortal women. Succubus: A spirit or dæmon who takes the shape of a woman and tempts or has carnal relations with mortal women.

To the Black Magician, however, the Incubus and Succubus are creatures of delight, to be summoned at will. It is harmless fun as long as the sorcerer or sorceress recognizes them for what they are, creations of his or her own mind, with no existence other than that which we choose to give them.

The evolution of the will and clarity of perception it brings enable us to see that things such as dæmon lovers are brought into being by our own heightened powers. This does not make the physical sensations any less real or satisfying. On the contrary, they can become highly intense and quite pleasurable. Kept in perspective, it can be a healthy, enjoyable experience.

The basic perception and understanding of the true nature and power of the Setian will should be mastered at this point in our evolution, as well as the application of that will to the universe around us and recognition of its resultant effects.
As the condition of the human race worsens, I'm inclined to think Setamorphosis is closer than one could imagine or suspect.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' is highly relevant for understanding the practical metaphysics and philosophical underpinnings of the Temple of Set's magical system in its formative years. The central article directly addresses the nature of 'entities' and the role of individual will and perception, a hallmark of modern esoteric currents. It establishes a clear distinction from more traditional occult views of daemonic interaction and emphasizes the internal locus of magical power. The administrative and community sections provide insight into the organizational structure and communal aspects vital for a growing esoteric order, reflecting the practical concerns and philosophical outlook of Setians in the late 1970s.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is initiated members of the Temple of Set, particularly those at the 'novice magician' stage progressing towards 'Setian' level, as well as the general membership. This is evident from the language used ('our evolution,' 'fledgling years'), the references to specific Setian ranks (IV°, I°), and the expectation of familiarity with prior 'Scroll of Set' content (the quiz). It also appeals to those interested in the practical application of will and the philosophical implications of subjective reality in a magical context, characteristic of contemporary Left-Hand Path philosophies.
